description: Number of "sorted permutations": permutations that can occur as the output of the sorting procedure described by Knuth.
references: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming Vol. 1, p. 238.
links: M. Bousquet-Mélou, Sorted or sortable permutations, Discrete Math., 225 (2000), 25-50.
J. West, Sorting twice through a stack, Theoret. Comput. Sci. 117 (1993) 303-313.
Index entries for sequences related to sorting
author: _Mireille Bousquet-Mélou_
extensions: Prepended a(0)=1 to match offset, added more terms, _Joerg Arndt_, Jul 01 2014
